module d_flip_flop (
    input clk,
    input reset,
    input d,
    output reg q
);
    always @(posedge clk or posedge reset) begin
        if (reset) begin
            q <= 1'b0;
        end else begin
            q <= d;
        end
    end
endmodule

module example_module (
    input clk,
    input reset_n,
    input [7:0] data_in,
    output reg [7:0] data_out
);

always @(posedge clk or negedge reset_n) begin
    if (!reset_n) begin
        data_out <= 8'h00;
    end
    else begin
        data_out <= data_in;
    end
end

endmodule

module counter (
    input wire clk,
    input wire reset,
    input wire load,
    input wire [3:0] data_in,
    output reg [3:0] count
);

always @(posedge clk or posedge reset) begin
    if (reset) begin
        count <= 4'b0;
    end else begin
        if (load) begin
            count <= data_in;
        end else begin
            count <= count + 1'b1;
        end
    end
end

endmodule

);

module bit_counter (
    input clk,
    input rst_n,        // Active-low asynchronous reset
    input en,           // Synchronous enable
    input load,         // Parallel load control
    input [3:0] data_in,// Parallel load data
    output reg [3:0] count
);

always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin          // Asynchronous reset
        count <= 4'b0;
    end
    else begin
        if (load) begin        // Synchronous parallel load
            count <= data_in;
        end
        else if (en) begin     // Synchronous increment
            count <= count + 1;
        end
    end
end

endmodule

module empty_module ();
endmodule

module sync_up_counter (
    input clk,
    input async_reset,
    input enable,
    output reg [3:0] count
);
    
always @(posedge clk or posedge async_reset) begin
    if (async_reset) begin
        count <= 4'b0;
    end
    else if (enable) begin
        count <= count + 1;
    end
end

endmodule

module counter_4bit (
    input clk,          // Clock input
    input rst_n,        // Active-low asynchronous reset
    input enable,       // Count enable control
    output reg [3:0] count  // 4-bit counter output
);

// Counter behavior with asynchronous reset
always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin          // Active-low reset condition
        count <= 4'b0;
    end
    else begin
        if (enable) begin      // Increment only when enabled
            count <= (count == 4'b1111) ? 4'b0000 : count + 1;
        end
    end
end

endmodule

module counter_4bit (
    input clk,
    input rst_n,        // Active-low asynchronous reset
    input enable,       // Count enable
    input load,         // Parallel load control
    input [3:0] data_in,// Parallel load data
    output reg [3:0] count, // Counter output
    output reg overflow // Overflow indicator
);

always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
        count <= 4'b0;
        overflow <= 1'b0;
    end
    else begin
        if (load) begin
            count <= data_in;
            overflow <= 1'b0;
        end
        else if (enable) begin
            if (count == 4'b1111) begin
                count <= 4'b0;
                overflow <= 1'b1;
            end
            else begin
                count <= count + 1;
                overflow <= 1'b0;
            end
        end
        else begin
            overflow <= 1'b0;  // Clear overflow when not enabled
        end
    end
end

endmodule

module basic_counter (
    input wire clk,
    input wire rst_n,
    input wire enable,
    output reg [3:0] count
);

always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
        count <= 4'b0000;
    end
    else if (enable) begin
        count <= count + 1'b1;
    end
end

endmodule

module counter_4bit (
    input clk,          // Clock input
    input rst_n,        // Active-low asynchronous reset
    input load_en,      // Synchronous load enable
    input cnt_en,       // Count enable
    input up_down,      // Count direction (1=up, 0=down)
    input [3:0] data_in,// Parallel load data
    output reg [3:0] cnt // Counter output
);

always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
        cnt <= 4'b0;    // Async reset
    end else begin
        if (load_en) begin
            cnt <= data_in; // Synchronous load
        end else if (cnt_en) begin
            cnt <= up_down ? cnt + 1 : cnt - 1; // Directional counting
        end
    end
end

endmodule

module shift_reg_8bit (
    input wire clk,
    input wire reset,
    input wire data_in,
    output reg [7:0] data_out
);

always @(posedge clk) begin
    if (reset) begin
        data_out <= 8'b0;
    end else begin
        data_out <= {data_out[6:0], data_in};
    end
end

endmodule

module shift_register (
    input wire clk,          // 100MHz clock
    input wire rst_n,        // Active-low asynchronous reset
    input wire load,         // Parallel load control
    input wire [15:0] data_in,  // Parallel data input
    input wire shift_in,     // Serial data input
    output reg [15:0] data_out, // Parallel data output
    output wire shift_out    // Serial data output
);

// Register implementation
always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
        data_out <= 16'h0000;  // Async reset
    end else begin
        if (load) begin
            data_out <= data_in;  // Parallel load
        end else begin
            // Right shift operation with serial input
            data_out <= {shift_in, data_out[15:1]};
        end
    end
end

// Continuous assignment for serial output (LSB)
assign shift_out = data_out[0];

endmodule

module d_flip_flop (
  input clk,
  input reset,
  input d,
  output reg q
);
  always @(posedge clk or posedge reset) begin
    if (reset) begin
      q <= 1'b0;

endmodule

module binary_counter (
    input wire clk,        // Clock input
    input wire reset,      // Synchronous reset (active high)
    input wire enable,     // Count enable (active high)
    output reg [3:0] count,// 4-bit counter output
    output wire terminal   // Terminal count (high at 15)
);

// Counter logic
always @(posedge clk) begin
    if (reset) begin
        count <= 4'b0000;  // Synchronous reset
    end else if (enable) begin
        count <= count + 1; // Increment when enabled
    end
end

// Terminal count detection
assign terminal = (count == 4'b1111); // High when count reaches 15

endmodule

module template (
    input        clk,      // Clock
    input        rst_n,    // Active-low reset
    input  [3:0] data_in,  // 4-bit input bus
    output reg [3:0] data_out  // 4-bit registered output
);

// 4-bit register with asynchronous reset
always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
        data_out <= 4'b0;  // Reset output to 0
    end else begin
        data_out <= data_in;  // Pass-through input
    end
end

endmodule

module simple_register (
    input wire clk,
    input wire rst_n,       // Active-low reset
    input wire [7:0] d_in,  // Data input
    output reg [7:0] d_out  // Data output
);

always @(posedge clk) begin
    if (!rst_n) 
        d_out <= 8'b0;      // Reset to 0
    else 
        d_out <= d_in;      // Normal operation
end

endmodule

module example_module (
    input clk,
    input reset,
    input enable,
    output reg [3:0] counter
);

always @(posedge clk or posedge reset) begin
    if (reset) begin
        counter <= 4'b0;
    end else if (enable) begin
        counter <= counter + 4'b1;

module bit_counter(
    input clk,
    input reset_n,
    input enable,
    output reg [3:0] count
);

always @(posedge clk or negedge reset_n) begin
    if (!reset_n) begin
        count <= 4'b0000;
    end
    else begin
        if (enable) begin
            count <= count + 1'b1;
        end
        // No else: counter holds value when enable is low
    end
end

endmodule

module pulse_generator (
    input wire clk,
    input wire reset_n,
    input wire enable,
    input wire pulse_type,
    output reg pulse_out
);

reg [3:0] counter;

// Counter control logic
always @(posedge clk or negedge reset_n) begin
    if (!reset_n) begin
        counter <= 4'b0;
    end else begin
        if (!enable) begin
            counter <= 4'b0;       // Reset counter when disabled
        end else begin
            counter <= counter + 1; // Free-running counter when enabled
        end
    end
end

// Pulse generation logic
always @(*) begin
    pulse_out = 1'b0;
    if (enable) begin
        case (pulse_type)
            1'b0: pulse_out = (counter == 4'b1111);          // Single-cycle pulse
            1'b1: pulse_out = (counter == 4'b1111) ||        // Two-cycle pulse
                             (counter == 4'b0000);
        endcase
    end
end

endmodule
